intro: Echinocystis brandegeei, commonly known as the yellow bignay, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a spiny, orange-colored gourd that matures in late summer.
